definition: to inflict heavy losses/to inflict serious damage
to begin/to initiate/to inaugurate/to start/to create

sentences.english: Izard says the prison buildings have been hard hit by the storm.
sentences.chinese: 伊泽德说，监狱的建筑受到强热带风暴的重创。

sentences.english: I counted four battleships definitely sunk, three severely damaged.
sentences.chinese: 我数了一数，有四艘主力舰无疑已经沉没，三艘重创。

sentences.english: He's bought the stocks of battered biotech and medical device makers.
sentences.chinese: 他选购的对象是遭受重创的生物技术股和医疗器械股。

sentences.english: The psychological impact of CIDT and physical torture was almost indistinguishable.
sentences.chinese: CIDT和肉体上的酷刑对心理的重创几乎相同。

sentences.english: The Russo-Japanese war of 1904-1905 was a military disaster for Russia.
sentences.chinese: 1905年的日俄战争令俄国遭到重创。

sentences.english: Put off your work, and your career and income will suffer.
sentences.chinese: 拖延工作则会使你的事业和收入遭受重创。

sentences.english: The crash devastated the U.S. figure skating community.
sentences.chinese: 那次空难重创了美国花样滑冰界。

sentences.english: Bank stocks across the region were also battered.
sentences.chinese: 银行类股票在整个区域遭受重创。

sentences.english: And the liberation army suppresses bandits the action begins, sufferred dense nots however people inflict heavy losses on.
sentences.chinese: 而解放军剿匪行动开始，却遭到了顽匪们的重创。

sentences.english: Rebels have suffered heavy causalities and are in desert. top rebel commander dead.
sentences.chinese: 反对派在沙漠中遭受重创，反对派高级指挥官巳亡。

sentences.english: The invading troops began to retreat after suffering heavy casualties.
sentences.chinese: 入侵的部队受重创后开始撤退。

sentences.english: Last year, UBS was forced to turn the Swiss state for help after getting caught up in the subprime crisis.
sentences.chinese: 去年，受到金融危机重创的瑞银被迫向瑞士政府求助。

sentences.english: On the occasion of the Ming and Qing dynasty change, the family suffered heavy losses, many people died.
sentences.chinese: 明清鼎革之际，家族遭受重创，多人罹难。

sentences.english: Companies associated with the travel and food industries could suffer after getting walloped in U.S. markets on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 周一美股旅游和食品加工行业的企业受重创。

sentences.english: There is a velocity with this capital which can whipsaw a marketplace.
sentences.chinese: 这类资本有可能迅速地对市场构成重创。

sentences.english: Without trees, Haiti lost its topsoil through erosion, crippling agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 没有了树木，海地土壤流失，重创了当地农业。

definition: to besiege/to beleaguer/to attack from all sides/to jointly speak or write against sb
to mount a sneak attack/to raid
total defeat of an army (idiom); fig. a complete wipeout
to be wounded/to sustain an injury
to deliver a punishing attack/to deal a heavy blow
